answerText: stress-energy-momentum tensor [or energy-momentum tensor][10] The Einstein tensor is equal to the stress-energy tensor times big G times 8 pi divided by this value.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale A | 18 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This tensor quantity contains terms for pressure and the density one of its namesake quantities along the diagonal. For 10 points each: [10] Name this quantity which is the source of the gravitational field in the Einstein field equations, and which represents generalized momentum flux.
